#300

- Growing in pair partially attached at the base of Eastern Red Cedar on the edge of thin mixed oak woodland.
- Caps light orange, conical with splitting fibers near the margin (white underneath) with veil remnants  on margin.
- Lamellae white, discoloring orangish where damaged by insects, not attached to stipe.
- Stipe white at apex turning light orange going down, fuzzy especially in upper half.
- Basal mycelium white, attached to duff.

Additional Info
- Smell: not distinctive
- Taste: pleasantly nutty
